channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1581] Samurai Jack & Powerpuff Girls: Are they the same universe?
item.description: What the hell happened to Townsville in the future?

item.title: [+1193] Are You Mature Enough for This Line Graph of Gay Marriage?
item.description: A new survey of same-sex marriage poll results posted to FiveThirtyEight.com suggests support for gay nuptials is--ahem--on the upswing.

item.title: [+1125] How a 16-Year Old Kid Made His First Million Dollars
item.description: This British boy—who lives in Corby, Northantshire—got his first computer age seven. Three years later he got a Mac and taught himself web design. Four years later—at age 14, in 2008—he started his first company. It was a simple site that some of you may now: Mac Bundle Box. The site was pretty, rooted into Apple's own design guidelines and style.

item.title: [+1075] Anderson Cooper Fights with Psycho GOP Congressman (Video)
item.description: "Terror Baby" mania is sweeping the U.S.! This crazy meme is the far-right's latest line of attack against the evil 14th amendment. Now, the argument's champion, Texas Rep. Louis Gohmert was on Anderson Cooper. They shouted a lot about it.

item.title: [+1068] If Verizon and Google Win, We Lose
item.description: If Google and Verizon get their way, no one will be able to stand up for wireless customers. Well-considered regulation is needed to stop outrageous practices

item.title: [+974] Religious Groups I'm Afraid Of (Infographic)
item.description: Not all religions are built the same. Some are just downright scary.

item.title: [+945] A Judge's Worst Nightmare
item.description: There are also probably cases that make a judge wish he hadn't gotten out of bed in the morning.

item.title: [+835] Android has now overtaken iPhone worldwide
item.description: Android is now larger than the iPhone on the world stage, analysts at Gartner said today. Google's phone platform jumped to 10.6 million phones sold, or enough to overtake the iPhone and take 17.2 percent of the market. The researchers believe Apple sold more iPhones than it shipped, at 8.47 million, but the higher number was still enough to ...

item.title: [+676] The Sexiest Women You Probably Haven't Heard Of (Yet) [PICS]
item.description: From a Bollywood star to a tennis ace, these gorgeous women deserve to be appreciated before TMZ ruins them for all of us.

item.title: [+664] Dr. Laura's Shocking, N-Word Filled Racist Rant (Audio)
item.description: Yesterday, Dr. Laura Schlessenger shocked her radio show audience when she argued with a black woman about racism and—among other things—said the word "nigger" six times. Today, Schlessenger apologized for her incredibly offensive rant. Audio and transcripts, inside.

item.title: [+646] Liberals Start "F*ck Tea" Party Campaign
item.description: A new progressive group called the Agenda Project has launched the "F*ck Tea" campaign. "Progress is the real American party," reads the campaign website's tag line.

item.title: [+558] How AT&T's iPhone Exclusivity Ends
item.description: If John Gruber is right, the iPod Touch will be upgraded in a matter of weeks with two cameras and the iPhone 4's retina display. I’m going to go out on a limb here and call this effectively the end of AT&T exclusivity.

item.title: [+538] You Know You've Been Spoiled Rotten by Technology When....
item.description: Technology has rewired our brains, altered our expectations, and, frankly, turned us all into cranks. How do you know if this has happened to you? Look for the following 21 warning signs.

item.title: [+537] Infographic of Evil
item.description: Have we shared to much with Google, Facebook and Apple?

item.title: [+482] How Does the Flux Capacitor Work? (Graphic)
[+469] 10 Wedding Trends That Must Be Stopped
item.description: Butterfly Releases - Yes, some crazy brides actually trap a bunch of winged bugs and release them into the air. Because, apparently, their union is so spectacular that they have to kidnap living creatures and create some fake-ass nature-inspired moment.

item.title: [+468] Anti-Piracy Failure Takes Down Creative Commons Videos
item.description: An anti-piracy group has caused a storm of controversy by taking down movies it has no rights to. GVU successfully ordered video hosting site Vimeo to take down several Creative Commons videos created by a freelance journalist and an independent filmmaker.The anti-piracy tracking company hired by GVU claims that its technology failed.

item.title: [+447] Chicago Girl, 8, Gunned Down While Jumping Rope
item.description: Police say two gunmen on bicycles killed an 8-year-old girl and wounded her younger cousin as the children were skipping rope in a Chicago neighborhood. Deputy Police Superintendent Ernest Brown says the shooting happened Tuesday evening in Roseland on Chicago's South Side. Brown says the two men rolled up on bicycles, fired, then fled.

item.title: [+446] 7 of Our Favorite A**holes in Sci-Fi
item.description: It also makes for some of the most satisfying moments in sci-fi when the story’s jerk gets his just desserts. Here are a few of our favorites: (Spoilers ahead)

item.title: [+442] Youth Unemployment Hits Record High
item.description: Global youth unemployment has hit a record high following the financial crisis and is likely to get worse later this year, the International Labor Organization (ILO) said Thursday.
